contextId.information: Memucan speaks to the king in third person as a form of respect. AT: If it pleases your Majesty ... from you ... before you ... Please ... your decree ... your vast kingdom" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_123person]])
contextId.quote: If it pleases the king ... from him ... before him ... Let the king ... the king's decree ... his vast kingdom

contextId.information: The servants spoke to the king in third person as a sign of respect. AT: "You should ... your official ... pleases you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_123person]])
contextId.quote: Let the king ... the king's official ... pleases the king

contextId.information: Haman speaks to the king in the third person as a sign of respect. AT: "your ... you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_123person]])

In order to show respect to a king, people sometimes did not call him "you." This can be translated with the word "you" along with other words that show respect. AT: "O King, if it pleases you, come and bring Haman ... for you" or "If you are willing to do this, Sir, come, and let Haman come with you .. for you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_123person]])
contextId.quote: If it pleases the king, let the king and Haman come ... for him

contextId.information: In order to show respect to a king, people sometimes did not call him "you." This can be translated with the word "you" along with other words that show respect. AT: "if you are pleased with me, O King, and if it pleases you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_123person]])
contextId.quote: if I have found favor in the eyes of the king and if it pleases the king

contextId.information: This can be translated with the word "you" along with other words that show respect. AT: "and I will answer your question" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_123person]])
contextId.quote: and I will answer the king's question

contextId.information: Here the king speaks of himself in the third person. This can be stated in first person and in active form. AT: "What should I do for the man whom I take pleasure in honoring" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_123person]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: What should be done for the man whom the king takes pleasure in honoring
